author: The Editorial Board
title: Europhoria Takes a Hit
text:
Ah, sweet europhoria. For a while in 2017, Europe imagined the end of the post-crisis blues. But already the buzz is ending as wary markets fret about a return to slow growth.
The latest evidence for gloom came in Wednesdayâ€™s revised eurozone inflation data for March, which suggested slightly more subdued price rises of 1.3% year-on-year than the 1.4% reported in the initial release this month. This follows declines in measures of industrial production, construction and retail sales in the first months of the year.
...
